intro: Ternstroemia huasteca, commonly known as Huastec beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Calycaraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and have a sweet, tart flavor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
